citations.desc: Cleaning, sanitization, housekeeping, and pest control.
citations.narrative:
There are four outdoor primary enclosures that have a moderate amount of feces in the yard that has not been picked up
on a daily basis. The yards were cleaned three days ago and need to be increased to daily pick up. There is an enclosure
with seven puppies that has a large buildup of feces and urine in the holding pan beneath the cage that needs to be
cleaned more often than once a day. There is too much accumulation with the large number of puppies requiring daily
pick up to be increased to at least twice a day to prevent the accumulation of feces and urine.
The buildup of feces can be a possible source of disease and discomfort for the regulated animals if they can not get
away from it, and a source of vermin and flies.
Excreta and food waste must be removed from primary enclosures daily, and from under primary enclosures as often as
necessary to prevent an excessive accumulation of feces and food waste, to prevent soiling of the dogs.
To be corrected by: July 21, 2021
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with licensee.
End Section

narrative:
3.11(a) 
   
Cleaning, sanitization, housekeeping, and pest control. 
There are four outdoor primary enclosures that have a moderate amount of feces in the yard that has not been picked up 
on a daily basis. The yards were cleaned three days ago and need to be increased to daily pick up.  There is an enclosure 
with seven puppies that has a large buildup of feces and urine in the holding pan beneath the cage that needs to be 
cleaned more often than once a day. There is too much accumulation with the large number of puppies requiring daily 
pick up to be increased  to at least twice a day to prevent  the accumulation of feces and urine. 
 
The buildup of feces can be a possible source of disease and discomfort for the regulated animals if they can not get 
away from it, and a source of vermin and flies. 
 
Excreta and food waste must be removed  from primary enclosures daily, and from under primary enclosures as often as 
necessary to prevent  an excessive accumulation of feces and food waste, to prevent soiling of the dogs. 
 
To be corrected by: July 21, 2021 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with licensee.

End Section
